## What is EchoAPI?
EchoAPI is a comprehensive API development tool that provides efficient support from design to debugging, load testing, and team collaboration. Plus, we offer a range of lightweight plugins like `EchoAPI for VS Code`, `EchoAPI for IntelliJ IDEA`, and `EchoAPI for Chrome` —all completely free and usable without login! And if you want to collaborate, you can securely log in for API data sync to meet your needs across different work scenarios. So go ahead and give it a try!

💻 [EchoAPI Client](https://www.echoapi.com/download)
👨‍💻 [EchoAPI for IntelliJ IDEA](https://www.echoapi.com/wiki/docs/idea/helper_old)
👨‍💻 [EchoAPI for VS Code]
🌐 [EchoAPI for Chrome](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/echoapi-interceptor/lbpejenchcbgbhhckegemaendoepnpko?utm_source=ext_sidebar)

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/3fd676ed-4cb8-495e-83a0-38edec0df865.png "image.png")

## Send an API Request

Simulate Sending a Request as Follows:

```js
curl -X GET "https://httpbin.org/anything" -H "accept: application/json"
```

1. **Create a Request: Import via cURL**

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/f02fe025-1f46-4882-9e42-59eebcc7bebb.png "image.png")

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/aaf606df-bc71-4250-ad57-1878402b792c.png "image.png")

2. **Edit Request Parameters**

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/70157c7d-b190-49d2-a81a-8f6a045aed07.png "image.png")

3. **Click Send to Receive the Response**

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/9d904f17-c25e-4c3a-855a-eaa3cc5854a4.png "image.png")

## Debug

1. **Select the Debug Environment**: Typically, we use environments to manage domain addresses for different environments.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/35d7e315-845c-4f78-9230-1432fa2efc9c.png "image.png")

2. **Fill in the Request Parameters**: If you need to use variables, you can reference them using `{{}}`.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/9c0fd38a-4790-478f-be46-f2558d0ef18b.png "image.png")

3. **After Editing, Execute the Operation**: Add assertions to validate the response results. Both visual assertions and script-based assertions are supported.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/5a8e7666-49ba-4f49-9a47-5c28b476ee74.png "image.png")

4. **Click Send to Obtain the Response**: Check the assertion results on the right side of the response area.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/282e9ea2-aced-4fe1-8291-08668cc71d78.png "image.png")

5. **Generate and Obtain the Request Code**: Click to generate and retrieve the request code for the interface.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/c365b753-c38f-42b2-b3c3-4d5ebcbbe2e4.png "image.png")

**More About Debug**

## Design & Mock
:::tip
Once the requirements are finalized, the backend can design the API in advance according to standard specifications. Then, Mock services can provide the frontend with Mock URLs, allowing the frontend development work to begin ahead of time.
:::

1. **Design the Basic Properties and Description of the API**

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/aba03884-ecd5-4980-916d-006ad00cc7dc.png "image.png")

2. **Design the API Request Parameters**

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/8363c02f-d8bc-4513-84a6-da19ca6e540b.png "image.png")

3. **Design the Expected Response**: Supports JSON Schema and can generate example values using JSON Schema.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/d370a249-996f-4b81-abfb-2f14a3f4b091.png "image.png")

4. **Set Mock Response Expectations**: Configure different conditions to return different expected results.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/7df66fc7-e994-4a44-88f8-32ea497db0a8.png "image.png")

5. **Provide the Mock URL to the Frontend**

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/e5f61fe7-6620-4295-8d78-e0960dc90a98.png "image.png")

**More About Design & Mock**

> [How to Design API Response Expectations in Advance 🔗](https://www.echoapi.com/wiki/docs/http/design#defining-response-example)  
> [Adding Extra Attribute Fields to API Design 🔗](https://www.echoapi.com/wiki/docs/project_set/api_attributes)

## Share Docs

1. **Click Share**: You can share an individual endpoint, a folder, or the entire project.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/bbaa59d2-087c-4a8f-af19-78707dfd1a0d.png "image.png")

2. **Copy the Link**: Share it with your colleagues.

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/dd812334-4793-4079-8d85-51f49f8de0c0.png "image.png")

3. **Receive a Well-Formatted API Document**

![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/34c08f8c-db5b-46d3-bd82-7df6e99ce744.png "image.png")

**More About Docs**

> [Set Passwords and Expiration Dates for Shares 🔗](https://www.echoapi.com/wiki/docs/docs/create-share)  
> [Manage Shares 🔗](https://www.echoapi.com/wiki/docs/docs/share)

## Testing

1. **Create a Test Case**

   ![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/952c8f24-9411-4fcb-b32c-0282f464cf58.png "image.png")

2. **Arrange Test Cases**: You can add endpoints or endpoint cases, and also incorporate various condition controllers.

   ![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/73b0aaf4-7b63-48bc-9b50-eac12cc765c1.png "image.png")

3. **Set Test Conditions**

   ![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/d311542f-08d2-48de-8387-3560aab435d6.png "image.png")

4. **Click Run** to view the test report results

   ![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/216740361954279424/log/ce5ab044-559f-493a-8c06-d0822094d7b6.png "image.png")

## How to invite collaboration?
1. **Click Invite** to obtain the invitation link

   ![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/0/log/c948c9d0-288f-4731-b3d8-199cd0a4b6d8.png "image.png")

2. **After obtaining the link**, send the invitation link to the invitee. The invitee can open the link and click "Join" to become part of the team.

   ![image.png](https://assets.echoapi.com/upload/user/0/log/6a2e5fb2-88cf-4595-9335-b2659d34f2fc.png "image.png")

**More About Collaboration**
